result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus M Ortega

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesus M Ortega appeared by video.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Jesus M Ortega.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Final Pretrial Conference.  Defense counsel advises Court that he will be in trial in another court and unable to proceed with trial.  Additionally, defense counsel advises Court that defendant wants to hire private counsel.  Court vacates previously scheduled jury trial date.  Defense counsel requests bail motion at next court hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 20, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. State's Witness List
Received and Filed .State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed. State's Motion to Join 21CM4093, 22CM155, 22CF477, and 22CM402
Received and Filed. State's Notice of Expert Testimony
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; State's Notice of Intent to use DNA Evidence

Defendant Jesus M Ortega in court.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Jesus M Ortega.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Jessica Behling. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Court will schedule case for final pretrial conference date.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 11/7/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jesus M Ortega in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. Case remains calendared for jury trial. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
JusticePoint Services Violation Report (new criminal charges), filed.

Defendant Jesus M Ortega in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. Court places case on trial calendar. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Jesus M Ortega in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Katherine Seelow on behalf of Jessica Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
22RM014281  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff 03/18/2022
Defendant's Motion for Dismissal Due to Violation of Due Process.  (Jesus Oretega - #2022001305, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant Jesus M Ortega not in court, in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court DENIES defense's motion to modify bail. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 35:
Defendant Jesus M Ortega in court with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland; both appear by video.  Defendant Jesus M Ortega in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 13CF5198. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Pittman.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 35.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.

Defendant Jesus M Ortega not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Oral No Contact Order with victims and witnesses stated on the record and in the complaint. State to file written order by next court date.

Defendant Jesus M Ortega in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Jesus M Ortega in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jesus M Ortega appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised that due to a lower pending matter this case has been re-assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 5, 6, 7, 8, and 9.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
